thread.title: Richies step up Benaud Day campaign
thread.title_full: Richies step up Benaud Day campaign

title: Richies step up Benaud Day campaign
text:
Use keywords to search content on this website Search Use keywords to search content on this website The Richies step up campaign for SCG Test to recognise Richie Benaud January 3, 2017 4:02pm David Warner's record breaking century at the SCG 00:48:03 
David Warner's record breaking century at the SCG 03 Jan 2017 3 hours /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/Cricket/Australian Internationals/ THE SCG is bathed in pink for this Test but it’s facing a challenge from cream, bone, white, off white, ivory or beige. 
More than 300 Richie Benauds will descend onto the SCG on Wednesday with calls to officially recognise day two of the Sydney Test in honour of the late cricket legend. 
AUSTRALIA’S DAY: Local batsmen dominate at SCG 
Officially dubbed “The Richies”, the group will don their trademark jackets and wigs, and bring along their Channel 9 microphones to the SCG. 
From humble beginnings seven years ago, the group has grown rapidly and embarked on a national tour in recent months with Richies featuring on day two of Tests throughout the summer. 
Group leader Michael Hennessy said 310 people were expected at the ground on Wednesday. 
“We started with 10 Richies the first year at the SCG in 2010,” Hennessy said. “This summer was the first time we’ve done all the other Tests. We are hoping to give the Barmy Army a run for its money next year.” 
Hennessy has called for official recognition of the day for the iconic Test captain, who died in 2015 aged 84. 
“We’d love day two at the SCG to be known as the Richie Benaud day,” Hennessy said. “Whether it be informally or formally we want day two to be about Richie.” 
About 80 Shane Warne lookalikes were on hand to watch Australia dominate on Tuesday. More Local News
